title: Print Concepts and Books

vocab.definition: Pages with words and pictures held together
One side of paper in a book
Letters put together that mean something
A group of words that tells a complete thought

teachingNotes: Demonstrate how to hold books correctly. Practice finding front, back, title. Show left-to-right reading direction.

sample.question: Where do you start reading on a page?
How do you hold a book?
Which way do you turn pages?
What tells you the name of a book?
Point to the title on this cover.
Show me the first word on the page.

truefalse.question: You read books from front to back.
Words are made up of letters.
You read from right to left.
Pictures can help tell a story.
You start reading at the bottom of a page.
Pages are turned from left to right.

multiplechoice.question: What is on the front of a book?

How do you know where a sentence ends?

fillintheblank.question: When you read, you move your eyes from _____ to right.

shortanswer.question: What can you learn by looking at the cover of a book?
Why do we read from left to right?
What parts does every book have?
expectedAny: front cover, pages, back cover, title

shortanswer.question: How do pictures help when reading?
What should you do before you start reading a book?
expectedAny: look at cover, find the title

shortanswer.question: Describe how to turn pages properly.
What makes words different from just letters?

wordProblems.question: A book has 20 pages. If you read 5 pages, how many pages are left to read?
Emma reads 3 books. Each book has 1 title. How many titles did she see?
There are 4 words in this sentence. If 2 words start with 'T', how many don't start with 'T'?
A story has 6 sentences. If you read 4 sentences, how many more do you need to read?
In the library, Sam looks at 8 book covers. If 3 covers have animals, how many don't have animals?
A picture book has words and pictures on each page. If there are 10 pages, how many pages have pictures?
Jake reads 2 pages before lunch and 3 pages after lunch. How many pages did he read total?
